title: The US sees the clouds of a financial crisis gathering on the horizon
summary: Financial bubbles, latent capital losses, opaque markets and abysmal public deficit: The warning signs of a financial shock are proliferating in an American economy that has not been able to rid itself of its slow poisons – high inflation and high interest rates.

title: Biden's Gaza plan, deemed 'positive' by Hamas, forces Netanyahu to face his contradictions
summary: The Israeli prime minister has been reluctant to explicitly commit himself to a ceasefire. His emissaries at the negotiating table suspect him of 'sabotaging' their efforts in order to prolong the war and keep himself in power.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Israeli far-right ministers threaten to quit if Biden ceasefire plan goes ahead
summary: Without Ben Gvir's and Smotrich's parties, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition could lose its majority in parliament.

title: Champions League: Record-breaking Madrid wins title for the fifteenth time
summary: The Spanish team has now won their last nine European Cup finals and won the competition six times in the last 11 seasons. However, not for the first time in that run, they had to rely on some good fortune as underdogs Dortmund were left to bitterly regret not making the most of their first-half chances.

title: In Mexico, the Left is expected to remain in power
summary: The presidential election on Sunday, June 2, 2024, should see the victory of Claudia Sheinbaum, the incumbent president's protege.

title: Paris's 'Nuit Blanche': Ten things to do in and around the city during the night-time arts festival
summary: A favorite of night owls, the cultural event is back for a 23rd edition on Saturday, June 1, with free performances and installations focused this year on French overseas territories.

title: In the UK, Nigel Farage hopes to win back disappointed Conservatives
summary: The former leader of the Brexit Party – now renamed Reform UK – is focusing his campaign for the July 4 snap general election on the issue of migration. Polls are giving his party 8% to 14% of the vote.

title: Kuwait: Former PM named new crown prince
summary: The 71-year-old sheikh served as the Gulf state's foreign minister from 2011 to 2019, and subsequently as prime minister until 2022.

title: In Sweden, the far right makes the political debate Trump-esque
summary: An investigative program has revealed that the Sweden Democrats party has been spreading disinformation via anonymous accounts. Party boss Jimmie Akesson has counter-attacked by denouncing an influencing campaign against his movement.

title: Chinese probe successfully lands on far side of Moon,  in growing space rivalry with US
summary: The official Xinhua News Agency said the landing module touched down Sunday, June 2, 2024, early in the morning, Beijing time. The mission is the sixth in the Chang’e moon exploration program, which is named after a Chinese moon goddess.

title: Paris 2024: Cycling already a winner
summary: The 'first cycling Games in history,' as the organizers call them, are based on the promise of 415 kilometers of bike lanes, some of which have been specially created for the event and will be retained after the Olympic Games. Some hope that the sporting event will stimulate bike use in the Paris metropolis, as it did after the pandemic.

title: Conspiracy or rule of law: Trump and Biden each try to exploit the New York verdict in their own way
summary: The day after his conviction in the Stormy Daniels hush money trial, the former US president presented himself as the sacrificial victim of a 'fascist state.' In contrast, the current American leader applauded the smooth running of institutions.

title: France's bad grade from Standard & Poor's shakes its economic credibility
summary: With the lowering of France's credit rating by S&P, the French draft budget for 2025 looks particularly difficult to put together, giving the impression that the current admnistration has done no better than its predecessors.

title: Centre Pompidou finally turns its attention to comics
summary: With 'Comics on Every Floor,' five simultaneous exhibitions featuring graphic novels, manga and comics celebrate a long-neglected art form in Paris.

title: Politics in the Bronx borough is a world away from Manhattan and Trump's legal troubles
summary: Attendees at Democratic Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's monthly town hall meeting on Thursday, May 30, mainly discussed issues of local concern.

title: ChatGPT: 'The Achilles heel of artificial intelligence is its energy consumption'
summary: The goal of phasing out coal as part of the transition to cleaner energy sources is clashing with the soaring electricity demands of the data centers required for the development of artificial intelligence, explains economic columnist Philippe Escande.

title: Michelle Obama's mother Marian Robinson dies at 86
summary: Robinson lived in the White House with the first family, helping care for her young granddaughters and providing a stabilizing presence in one of the world's most stressful residences.

title: Mexico hit with relentless, deadly heatwave
summary: At least 61 deaths in Mexico have been attributed to the calamitous heat wave that has baked the country for over a month, authorities said on Monday, with record-breaking temperatures exacting a severe toll on both human life and the natural environment.

title: Female Moroccan minister summoned to talk about her private life
summary: Leila Benali, in charge of the country's energy transition, is suspected of a conflict of interest due to an alleged relationship with the founder of an Australian mining group. For feminist circles, her treatment differs from that reserved for men.

title: China to act "with determination and force" to prevent Taiwanese independence
summary: Defense minister Dong Jun, who is attending a major security forum in Singapore, also welcomed the "stabilization" of relations between his country and the United States.

title: A former French president's scooter, sold at auction, has become a pop icon
summary: The three-wheeled machine that François Hollande rode to visit his mistress during his presidency was sold at auction on May 26. Now an incongruous relic of the French Republic, it will join an automobile museum.

title: Historian Olivier Wieviorka: 'D-Day makes for great storytelling'
summary: D-Day is one of those few historical events that can be commemorated in a joyful and festive spirit, says the professor, who explains the widespread enthusiasm of the French people for the D-Day landings of June 6, 1944.

title: French finance minister says credit rating cut means savings needed
summary: Bruno Le Maire said he was determined to find another €10 billion in savings this year after Standard and Poor's downgraded France's credit score from AA to AA-.

title: Yet again, French Open fails to fill gaping holes of empty hospitality seats
summary: Like in recent years,  the empty boxes on the center court at the Parisian tournament are a source of controversy. Organizers seem powerless to fix the problem.

title: Claudia Sheinbaum, Mexico's likely feminist-in-chief
summary: On June 2, the left-wing former mayor of Mexico City is expected to win Mexico's presidential election. At 61, Sheinbaum is buoyed by her advocacy actions for women's rights, in a country where the number of femicides has reached record highs.

title: India: Heatstroke kills 33 election staff in one state on last day of voting
summary: The chief electoral officer of the state of Uttar Pradesh said 33 polling personnel died because of heat that reached temperatures above 45°C. One voter also died.

title: Businesswoman set to become Iceland's president as former PM concedes
summary: Halla Tomasdottir becomes the second woman to hold the largely ceremonial position in Iceland, beating former prime minister Katrin Jakobsdottir.

title: Iranian ex-president Ahmadinejad registers for election to replace late Raisi
summary: Iran's hardline former president Mahmoud Ahmadinejad registered for the June 28 presidential election that was called after the death of President Ebrahim Raisi in a helicopter crash.

title: EU elections: Macron's coalition tries to remotivate members at last major rally
summary: Several figures from the presidential bloc, including Prime Minister Gabriel Attal, took to the stage on Saturday near Paris to support their lead candidate Valérie Hayer, a week before the European election.

title: Zelensky accuses China of 'working hard to prevent' countries from attending peace summit
summary: As Ukraine's president urged countries to participate in the conference, China said it should have 'equal participation' and 'recognition' of Ukraine and Russia.

title: Euro 2024: 'I'm Lilian's son, but above all, I'm Marcus Thuram'
summary: After a successful season with Inter Milan, the eldest son of the 1998 world champion has been included in Didier Deschamps' list of 25 players selected for the 2024 European championships.

title: Joe Biden, trapped by his support for Israel, seeks a way to end war in Gaza
summary: On Friday, the American president presented a three-phase plan for a ceasefire. Hamas has described the proposal as 'positive.'

title: How do the upcoming European Union elections work?
summary: Between June 6 and 9, the EU's 27 member states will elect the members of the European Parliament. Here's how an election involving nearly 360 million eligible voters is run.

title: D-Day 80th anniversary week kicks off with mass parachute jump over Normandy
summary: Veterans and world leaders are among those expected later in the week to celebrate the Normandy landings of June 6, 1944.

title: Standard & Poor's downgrade of France's credit rating, a wake-up call for the government
summary: The American rating agency has downgraded France's debt rating from AA to AA-. While this downgrade will have little effect on the country's financing conditions, it does shake up the government, whose economic credibility has until now been one of its main political assets.
